author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thudiyalur Police have arrested five persons on the charges of attacking three persons with deadly weapons over a land dispute, on Saturday.

The police said that a civil dispute between the complainant M. Palanisamy (65) of Perundurai, Erode, and the prime accused R. Prakash (30) of Vellakinar, in Thudiyalur, was pending before the Judicial Magistrate – IV in Coimbatore.

The dispute was over 1.64 acres at M.R. Thootam at Vellakinar that was purchased by Palanisamy.

Inquiry revealed that the former landlord Kasammal made a deal to sell the land to Prakash but it did not work out as she demanded more money.

On Saturday, Palanisamy brought a few persons to clean the land, when Prakash picked a quarrel with them.

When Palanisamy and others were proceeding to Thudiyalur Police Station to lodge a complaint against the accused, Prakash, A. Karunakaran, P. Gowtham and two others attacked them.

Private hospital

Victims B. Vijay (23) who was stabbed and R. Shankar (26) and M. Malleswaran (32) who suffered fractures were admitted in a private hospital in the city.

The Thudiyalur Police booked the accused under sections 307 (attempt to murder), 147 (punishment for rioting), 148 (rioting with deadly weapon) and 341 (punishment for wrongful restraint) of the Indian Penal Code.

The accused were arrested and remanded on Sunday.
title: Five held for attempt to murder
